llm_calls.prompt:
<task>
Extract the accurate company name from this job application page.
</task>

<context>
URL_COMPANY: Harper

PAGE_TITLE: Founding Product Manager @ Harper

HEADINGS: Founding Product Manager
Location
Employment Type
Location Type
Department

NAV_LINKS: - Overview
- Application

FORM_LABELS: Name
Email
Resume
Back to Harper’s Job Listings
Loading...
Learn more about Ashby

COMPANY_LINKS: None

JOB_DESCRIPTION_SAMPLE: LocationSan FranciscoEmployment TypeFull timeLocation TypeOn-siteDepartmentEngineeringCompensation$135K – $185K • Offers Equity • Offers BonusOverviewApplicationAutofill from resumeUpload your resume here to autofill key application fields.Upload fileDrop your resume here!Parsing your resume. Autofilling key fields...NameEmailResumeUpload Fileor drag and drop hereSubmit Application
</context>

<instructions>
1. The URL suggests the company name is "Harper", but this may be an ASCII-only slug that differs from the actual display name
2. Look for the company name mentioned across multiple sources (headings, labels, links, description)
3. Prioritize:
   - Names that appear consistently across multiple sources
   - Proper capitalization and special characters (prefer "Zūm" over "Zum" or "Ridezum")
   - Names in navigation links to company homepage
   - Names in form labels like "Why do you want to work at [Company]?"
4. If multiple variations exist (e.g., "Ridezum" in URL vs "Zūm" on page), choose the properly formatted display name
5. Return ONLY the company name with no additional text or explanation
6. If no clear company name can be extracted from the context, return the URL company name as fallback
</instructions>

<output_format>
[Company Name Only]
</output_format>
